alert.note: Alert for Kern (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 04 at 4:11AM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following county, Kern. * WHEN...Until 615 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 411 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of North Central Kern County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
